metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16435 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Little CMS (aka Little Color Management System) 2.9 has an integer overflow in the AllocateDataSet function in cmscgats.c, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow in the SetData function via a crafted file in the second argument to cmsIT8LoadFromFile.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

liblcms2-2 - 2.9-1ubuntu0.1
liblcms2-utils - 2.9-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
lcms2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9-1ubuntu0.1').
